title: Confusing error message about missing crate dependency in build.rs script

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.

If you cannot produce a minimal reproduction case (something that would work in
isolation), please provide the steps or even link to a repository that causes
the problematic output to occur.
-->

Given the following code:

Cargo.toml:
```
[dev-dependencies]
savon = "0.2"
```

build.rs:
```rust
use std::env;

fn main() {
    let out_dir = env::var("OUT_DIR").unwrap();
    let s = savon::gen::gen_write("./src/wsdl/serversync.wsd.xml", &out_dir).unwrap();
}
```

The current output is:

```
error[E0433]: failed to resolve: use of undeclared crate or module `savon`
 --> build.rs:5:13
  |
5 |     let s = savon::gen::gen_write("./src/wsdl/serversync.wsd.xml", &out_dir).unwrap();
  |             ^^^^^ use of undeclared crate or module `savon`

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0433`.
```

<!-- The following is not always necessary. -->
Ideally the output should look like:

```
error[E0433]: failed to resolve: use of undeclared crate or module `savon`
 --> build.rs:5:13
  |
5 |     let s = savon::gen::gen_write("./src/wsdl/serversync.wsd.xml", &out_dir).unwrap();
  |             ^^^^^ use of undeclared crate or module `savon`

  note: savon is listed in dev-dependencies but it must be listed in build-dependencies to be used from a build script

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0433`.
```

cc @wycats
